name: Gabriel Kreuther
address: 41 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

reviews.text:
Racist server, with painfully obvious discriminatory treatment - not just to my own table but also to neighboring table with Asian guests. Emailed management with no response.

Absolutely Would not recommend
Have a reservation.

Wonderful dining experience. Staff was engaging and attentive, even paying close attention to my daughterâ€™s age and bringing her non-alcoholic alternatives for amuses and such. Food was amazing and I will be dreaming about the duck for the rest of my life.

The wine list is great. As far as the food goes everything was really good but nothing was memorable. Not a single course that I would crave to eat again and go back for. For half this price you have better gastronomical experiences easily available in NYC. Based on taste of food alone the place is a 3.5 star absolute and 2 star relative to price and branding. Michelin got this wrong. Yes the service and ambiance etc should help a place get an extra star or two but the food needs to shine before the other aspects add up . Here the food is very good  but just doesnâ€™t deserve to be rated as high as I was sadly led to believe. Not going back.

I decided to come in for a quick drink and bar bite, and I was quite amazed. The herbe sacrÃ©e is now one of my all time favorite cocktails. Also Katie is a genius behind the bar and cocktails. Huge shoutout to her and the drinks coming very soon. This was an extremely memorable experience, and Iâ€™ll be back soon.

Worth it.

Everytying was great. Quite pleased with the service.

A few items did stand out:
Rosemary ice cream is fabulously unique
Smoking the duck breast was a nice touch
Melon with the fois gras was a great juxtaposition

I'll return
A wonderful experience. We enjoyed their excellent tasting menu combined with delicious wine choices. Terrific food and great service. Definitely coming back. Strong recommendation.

The best restaurant I ate in my life - w a u
Words can't begin to describe the Disneyland of flavor
And the service was excellent
Ulises was my waiter - he was very kind and sweet
Thank you for that unforgettable experience
Amazing experience.  Excellent service and excellent service. I will definitely come back.

Fuimos de aniversario y fue una noche preciosa y el servicio espectacular
La comida deliciosa y platillos donde cuidaron cada detalle

I had the absolute pleasure of celebrating my 40th birthday at Gabriel Kreuther, and I could not have chosen a more perfect place. As a two-star Michelin restaurant, it is worthy of every accolade, and then some.
The beautiful, contemporary dÃ©cor immediately set the tone for an unforgettable evening. The service was immaculate; attentive, warm, and professional in a way that made me feel truly celebrated.
We opted for the four-course menu each, which was a culinary journey from start to finish. Every dish was thoughtfully crafted, bursting with flavor, and plated to perfection. The desserts were absolutely delightful, and we couldnâ€™t resist indulging in Gabriel Kreutherâ€™s signature chocolates. They were decadent, silky-smooth, and melted in the mouth with layers of exquisite flavor.
This experience was not just another meal at Michelin Restaurant, it was a memory. Thank you, Gabriel Kreuther, for making my milestone birthday truly unique and unforgettable.

Amazing experience at Gabriel Kreuther! The chefâ€™s tasting menu with wine pairing was outstanding, each course perfectly balanced. Service was exceptionalâ€”Jeremy made the evening even more special with his warm and attentive care. Truly one of NYCâ€™s best dining experiences.
Gabriel Kreuther is exceptional! Elegant atmosphere, exquisite French-inspired cuisine, and impeccable service. Perfect for a refined and memorable dining experience in New York.

The food here is very good and they were mindful of my allergies. We have been here several times and they have never disappointed. Itâ€™s just a little bit sad that they do not have the to share flatbread anymore because that was really good

Lovely tasting menu, great atmosphere and professional service. Don't have to wait months for a reservation and get to enjoy top notch cuisine at the same time. I liked the duck and the cocktail offerings.
The service was amazing, and the food - just wow! Not only was it delicious, it was downright fun. A wonderful place to go for an anniversary.
Delicious food in a lovely atmosphere. Highly recommended

Stunning dining experience! The quality of service, culinary expertise, presentation, atmosphere, and experience were divine and delicious. Highly recommend the chefâ€™s dinner, special martini, and wine pairings.

Everything about Gabriel Kreuther restaurant was incredible! They made our experience on a friends' trip truly special. We tried the four-course menu and it was simply delicious!  You won't be disappointed. We live in Miami and will return to New York to take our husbands. I don't remember the names of the dishes, but here are some pictures. Simply phenomenal. Thank you

A true experience to have at least once in your life. We had the full-time tasting menu and every dish was outstanding. The staff were wonderful and even offered to move us to a better table when they saw that I preferred sitting next to my date instead of in front.
Excellent food and cocktails  one of the best restaurants in nyc!
Best

Our group of friends went to Gabriel for a birthday and had a fantastic time. Our server Ulises was very kind and helpful. Food was delicious and very memorable. Our favorites of the meal were the oysters (amuse), cheese course, orecchiette, and the wine. Itâ€™s been about two weeks since we last visited but we havenâ€™t stopped talking about this place since. They even gave us left-handed silverware!

I wish I could give it 10 stars. As someone not from the city, I felt at home here. From other guests, to the employees. Everyone was so kind and welcoming. Food was amazinggggg. Probably the richest food I've ever had. Definitely left very full.

Everything about this restaurant was amazing! They truly made our experience for our anniversary very special. We did the tasting menu and just wow!! If you can go here, so it now. You will not be disappointed. I really can't say any more about it, as I don't remember all the dishes. Just phenomenal!!
We had a fabulous evening filled with top notch cocktails, knowledgeable servers, & incredibly delicious food! The caviar was to die for! A must in NYC ğŸ¤©
Best Restaurant i love itâ¤ï¸

My husband and I ate here roughly 3 years ago and had one of the most amazing times! We had the regular chefs tasting and ended up chatting with the manager and he took us back to meet everyone in the kitchen! They gave us a little tour and we even took pictures with the crew! It was amazing!!!! And we have been speaking about going back ever since! So I decided to surprise him with reservations for our anniversary in December 2 days before Christmas. Itâ€™s a crazy time of year so I wanted to make sure I could get a table. Currently heâ€™s deployed over seas and I thought it would a perfect gift for when he comes back! I emailed about reservations for the chefs table. My initial email I received a reply. I then followed up with 2 more questions and no response! I send a follow up email and still nothing! For such a high end restaurant this is unacceptable customer service. I guess I will spend my $1k+ on one dinner somewhere else. Iâ€™m so devastated because I know my husband would have been so happy to go but now out of principle I refuse to ever dine here again.

Updateâ€¦. two months later and still havenâ€™t heard from Paul the head of operations. Absolutely laughable that this is how this establishment treats their customers.
Excellent tasting menu, really enjoyed sweet breads but every dish was impeccable and delicious. So much intention and execution with every moment here.

Dining atÂ Gabriel KreutherÂ was a truly exceptional experienceNestled just across from Bryant Park, the restaurant offers a serene and elegant setting that perfectly complements its Michelin-star distinction.

From the moment we arrived, the staff was warm and professional, striking the perfect balance between attentive and friendly service. It was an ideal atmosphere for a leisurely lunch and meaningful conversation with friends.

Each course was executed with finesseâ€”thoughtfully composed, exquisitely presented, and utterly delicious. Every recommendation from the staff was spot-on, and the flavors were nothing short of sublime. Itâ€™s evident that every detail, from the ingredients to the pacing of the meal, is handled with the utmost care.

We left feeling inspired and already looking forward to our next visit. Gabriel Kreuther is a culinary gemâ€”an experience you will savor long after the last bite.

ExpÃ©rience trÃ¨s dÃ©cevante.
Par oÃ¹ commencer ?
Ambiance extrÃªmement bruyante et dÃ©coration atypique.
Mais câ€™est loin dâ€™Ãªtre le plus surprenant et dans le mauvais sens du terme.
Nous avons commandÃ© un menu du chef en sept services.
Je ne mange pas dâ€™huÃ®tres et quelle ne fut pas ma surprise lorsque je constate que mon conjoint a son plat dâ€™huÃ®tre et que moi jâ€™ai exactement la mÃªme chose, mais sans huÃ®tre: Câ€™est-Ã -dire un petit condiment avec de la poire seulementâ€¦
Pourquoi ne pas avoir remplacÃ© le plat tout simplement ? Nous sommes habituÃ©s Ã  faire trÃ¨s rÃ©guliÃ¨rement des restaurants Ã©toilÃ©s  Michelin et câ€™est bien la premiÃ¨re fois que cela nous arrive. Ã€ chaque fois, le chef prend habituellement la peine de modifier le plat.
Bref, on aurait pu dire quâ€™on allait sâ€™adapter Ã  cela relativement frustrant tout de mÃªme,
et attendons la suite avec impatience.
Concernant les six autres plats :Plein dâ€™erreurs, dâ€™accord de saveurs:  Des plats trop Ã©picÃ©s (bass-poisson blanc avec du pimentâ€¦), parfois insipides (croquette sans saveur) dâ€™autres fois pas assez cuits : les ris de veau !! Dâ€™autres avec un goÃ»t tellement fort : lâ€™esturgeon Ã©tait vraiment prÃ©dominant et trop fort en bouche
Et dâ€™autres vraiment sans intÃ©rÃªt: le canard qui avait le goÃ»t de fumÃ© et qui avait encore des nerfs Ã  lâ€™intÃ©rieur ou encore les coquilles Saint-Jacques, avec aussi un goÃ»t de fumÃ© beaucoup trop prononcÃ© â€¦ qui ne laissait aucune subtilitÃ© aux saveurs, quel dommage !
Mon avis peut sembler dur, mais sincÃ¨rement nous avons rarement aussi peu apprÃ©ciÃ© un repas Ã©toilÃ© et nous ne comprenons pas lâ€™engouement pour cette cuisine.
Le service Ã©tait lui aussi trÃ¨s bancalâ€¦ nous avons dÃ» rÃ©pÃ©ter Ã  plusieurs reprises, que oui, nous souhaitions Ãªtre dÃ©barrassÃ©s.
Nous avions Ã©galement beaucoup de mal Ã  comprendre les explications des plats du au fort accent des serveursâ€¦
En revanche, pour nous proposer un extra truffe que nous avons pris Ã  95 $ par personne,  On a bien Ã©tÃ© incitÃ© Ã  le prendre, et avons vraiment regrettÃ©, tant la truffe nâ€™avait que peu de goÃ»t..

Bref, Ã©videmment, nous ne reviendrons pas et sommes trÃ¨s dÃ©Ã§us de cette expÃ©rience.
On se demande vraiment qui sont les inspecteurs Michelin qui ont accordÃ© deux Ã©toiles Ã  ce restaurantâ€¦. Heureusement les autres sont biens mieux!
Peut-Ãªtre que le chef Ã©tait en vacances ? Nous ne saurons pas nous ne lâ€™avons pas vu.
Heureusement que nous nâ€™avions pas quelque chose Ã  fÃªter
Nous avons eu le sentiment de nous faire voler car le tout nous aura quand mÃªme coÃ»tÃ© 1500 $!!

En bref un seul mot : Dommage

We missed our reservation the night before, our own fault. We are in the bar the next night. Iâ€™m so thankful we did! We havenâ€™t had a meal that satisfied on every level since. The service was on point. The food from the old country was cooked to perfection. Will definitely go back!

This will become a must for your fine dining list. From the front desk to the dining table, staff was professional, friendly, and knowledgeable. Food and drinks were perfection. Treat yourself to an amazing dinning experience without.
If you do any of the tasting menus, they really go over the top. Many items came out that were not listed on the menu both as appetizers and desserts. Lovely and attentive staff.

IMPECCABLE. EXCEPTIONAL. MASTERFUL. Gabriel Kreuther has perfected the art of blending German cuisine with French cuisine.

The atmosphere boasts bold hunter-like elements of the forest (even down to the silverware), perhaps the Black Forest, and combines with the romantic, French countryside.

Each dish is a masterful display of fusion. The flavors and textures donâ€™t compete with one another. They dance.

The presentation lacks no dramatic effect. Smoke, fire, foam, flower, crystallization, and ice. Every element, every detail comes together as a symphony of flavor.

Chefâ€™s kiss ğŸ’‹

5 stars!

Came here for my birthday dinner and had such a good time. I was running late but they still saved my table, which I really appreciated. The staff were all super nice and friendly. They even gave me a birthday card that was so cute, I really loved it. Most of the food was amazing. The salmon roe was a little too fishy for me, but everything else tasted great. The oyster from the chef was such a nice surprise and the meat was cooked perfectly. Definitely a memorable night

Overall my experience here was really nice. The cocktail was probably one of the best Iâ€™ve had. The bread was to die for, the amuse-bouche is certainly memorable, and my lobster was fabulous. The lamb saddle left a bit to be desired and fell short in my opinion. However, the dessert was good, with the complimentary one being especially delicious. The staff were very kind and attentive, even helping us catch a cab on a busy Saturday night.
Excellent. The drinks, duck, and ube desert were all exceptional.

Celebrating our 10th anniversary at the Chef's Table was an unforgettable experience. Watching the chefs craft each dish with such precision and passion was like culinary theater. Every plate was a work of art, but the highlight for me was the rich and flavorful dry-aged smoked duck. To top it all off, my wife is convinced she's found the best dessert she has ever tasted in Manhattan.
I like their bread, but the meat is indeed over-seasoned
Very nice experience!

This was my first trip to NYC and the perfect start to my visit. I love ube flavored things and came across a post on Instagram of the ube pearl. I couldnt wait to try it on my trip. It actually wasnt part of the a la cart menu but they made an exception since it was my birthday and it did not disappoint.  The duck breast was the best Ive ever had. I really ventured out of my comfort zone here and loved it. Im not a fan of saurekraut but the Sturgeon & Sauerkraut tart was delicious. The service was top tier! They were so attentive and knowledgeable.  The bread and cheese dip is amazing as well!

We recently spent a week in NYC to enjoy the sights and to celebrate my partners birthday. We enjoyed many incredible meals, but the standout was dinner at Gabriel Kreuther, where every course was a work of art. Yen took care of us that evening and made us feel very welcome the minute we sat down.  He offered recommendations and explained each dish to us.  Every recommended dish was a stand-out. The evening was made even more special when the manager surprised us with a visit to the kitchen to meet the chefâ€”a warm and generous gesture that elevated an already exquisite experience. It was a truly unforgettable way to celebrate my partnerâ€™s birthday early, surrounded by elegance and exceptional hospitality.

Such a disappointment. I went to Gabriel for a dinner in May 2025.
First of all the dining room is EXTREMELY noisy, very uncomfortable and zero soul.
The service is kind but average, far from European standards. The food itself is fine. Main dish with the Wagyu and the dessert with chocolate are the highlights, the rest is never a 2 Michelin Star quality.
The room itself is average and AC is blowing on your shoulders.
Overall a very average place, for which I paid 620$/head (service included)
I do not recommend this place at all, the room and the food can not command such prices.

I've been there several times and the food and service are always outstanding. From the bartender, to the servers and the manager- they know how to take care of their guests. The food is exquisite and the menu is updated seasonally. Highly recommended

Had Chef's Tasting Menu for lunch with my wife on the 7th. Our expectation was vastly exceeded both in quality AND quantity of food.

The woefully meager extent of my food vocabulary (I am a banker with little leasure time) fails me in expressing the palatal bliss I experienced, and it's killing me. From the oyster amuse-bouche and many many food on the way to the Alsatian (probably...) steak entrÃ©e, I was blown away further and further to the proverbial cloud nine.

About the amount of the food - at some point we tried to sneak out before there would be another round of food servings, but the check didn't come out until the kitchen had their fill of feeding us to their satisfaction. We were already beyond full after the main dish, and then there followed a pre-desert plate, deserts & a complementary welcome-to-nyc soufflÃ©,  and then there were final sweets to close it all off.

Service was great, too. Thomas was great with us, and the servers who brought out the dishes & explained the menu were professionally aloof but never to a fault at that.

New York's an expensive city, and I wouldn't say what we paid was little, but "the most bang for your buck" is not an expression that does justice for this restaurant - you get (for no right word comes to my mind) like a hydrogen bomb of tasting pleasure for every cent you'd pay here.

Top notch all the way around. Running circles around JG and DB (you know who I mean) whoâ€™ve extended their empires and â€œfranchisesâ€ so far that theyâ€™ve lost the plot of the true Michelin and fine dining (labor intensive, creative) experience. Gabriel Kreutherâ€™s menu, attention to detail, hands-on â€œpresenceâ€ is felt and tasted in every bite, the presentation, the experience. Cannot wait to return
Celebrated our anniversary. The meal was wonderful! Then there was the added bonus of the staff recognizing our celebration with some extra treats and attention. Highly recommend!

Speechlessâ€¦This is my top 3 restaurant in NYC! Iâ€™m so grateful that Iâ€™ve chosen Gabriel Kreuther to celebrate my birthday and made a memorable meal for my special day. Of course the chefâ€™s testing menu is to die for please donâ€™t go out of your way, I love every single course that has been served to my table from the start to the end. Phenomenal, unbelievable, amazing, delicious, excellent and what else??? 10 10 10 hands down. ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ
Really amazing dinner experience. The staff are all so lovely and the food is amazing. Highly recommend!

It was a satisfying dinner.
I'll visit again :)

í…Œì´í¬ì•„ì›ƒ ì „ìš© ì¼€ì´í¬ ì˜¨ë¼ì¸ì£¼ë¬¸í•„ìˆ˜

This place is so peaceful and the dining room just has so much natural light. I loved all the food (aside from anything with yuzu in it but the staff quickly changed all future dishes to not have it). The food was really good and the timing between courses was spot on. I would say they deserve their 2 Michelin stars.

From the warm welcome to the impeccable service, every aspect of my experience was exceptional. The cuisine, rooted in Alsatian traditions, integrates French and German influences while incorporating innovative elements. Standout dishes included the seasonal pumpkin dessert and the tarragon-kiwi palate cleanser, both of which impressed not only with their harmonious blend of flavors but also textures. Additionally, the non-alcoholic cocktails were thoughtfully crafted, offering layered flavor profiles. I highly recommend this to anyone seeking a well-rounded and memorable dining experience.

We had a great foodie experience here. We booked the chefs table and got to sit right in the kitchen watching all the magic happen.  Fanatic tasting menu, wine pairings superb. If you are a foodie worth a visit to NYC to check it out!

We went for the tasting menu at the chefs table. What a wonderful evening, which we agreed was a spirited evening of entertainment and fine dining.
Our son is a talented chef back in Scotland, so we wanted to do something special for him. Thereâ€™s a camaraderie between chefs and they took him under their wings for a chefs tour around the fine establishment. He was really touched by their kindness when they presented him with a lovely book that they all signed. He treasured the experience which means so much to us as parents.
As for the food, well it was world class as you would expect, beautifully prepared and presented, and the accompanying wines, a perfect pairing. It was truly a once in a lifetime experience for us, but more so our Ryan. Thank you all, you never know, he may want to come and work with you.

We thoroughly enjoyed this experience summer 2024 which infuses nostalgia, beauty, and story into a meal. This was one of the best chef's tasting menus we've ever had. Everyone working here is also really down to earth and kind. A wonderful experience to share with your loved ones!

This fantastic restaurant in front of Bryant Park is perfect in every wayâ€”location, ambiance, food, and service.

The spacious interior ensures privacy, so you donâ€™t have to overhear conversations from nearby tables.

Whether you choose the three- or four-course prix fixe, the experience feels like a full-course meal, complete with delightful amuse-bouches. Each dish is incredibly creative and beautifully presented, making for a truly unique dining experience.

Over three hours of enjoying food and wine, the service remained impeccably attentive and friendly.

I've been to many 3-star, 2-star and 1-star Michelin restaurants, so using this context to rate Gabriel Kreuther, which has 2 Michelin stars.  While we had a good meal, it was not at the 2 Michelin star level ... more like 1 ... at best.  We had the Chef's Tasting Menu, which consisted of 7 courses for $265, which is a fairly reasonable price.  Most of our courses were pretty good and creative, though the fluke was overcooked and was too dry,  the ravioli were so-so and the sturgeon tart was too flaky and dry.  The dishes were nicely presented, but not at the 2 Michelin star level.  But the biggest issue was service, which was not even at the 1-star level.  Our server was mostly nowhere to be found and was not at all attentive.  He spoke in a way that was hard to understand.  Our table was not cleaned timely between courses and once they brought another course with the empty dishes from the prior one still sitting on our table.  Not the end of the world, of course, but should never happen at a 2 Michelin star restaurant where I am paying over $1000 for a dinner for 2 people).  The delay between courses was too long at times.  Some courses came pretty quickly and others had a much longer delay.  Water was not always added when we ran out, etc.  Really disappointing service.  Overall, not a bad meal, but not at the 2 Michelin star level.

This week, my boyfriend and I visited the two-Michelin-starred restaurant Gabriel Kreuther to celebrate my birthday. We opted for the four-course dinner, and it was an absolutely amazing experience.

From the moment we arrived, the staff were exceptionally attentive and friendly. Everyone, from the reception to the waitstaff, congratulated us, and we even received a personally signed card from the chef. As a lovely surprise, we were offered a complimentary glass of sparkling wine at the start since our selected wine wasnâ€™t ready. Throughout the meal, we were delighted with different amuse-bouches after every course, and at the end, we were treated to a special complimentary dessert with a personalized congratulatory message.

The food itself was incredibleâ€”both delicious and beautifully presented. Some of my favorites included the Sturgeon & Sauerkraut Tart (GKâ€™s signature dish), the Two-Week Aged Hay-Smoked Long Island Duck Breast with blistered cranberries, parsnip cream, and sweet potato, and the Cashew and Wild Mushroom PÃ¢tÃ© with Ossetra caviar.

Overall, it was an unforgettable dining experience, filled with thoughtful touches and outstanding cuisine. I highly recommend Gabriel Kreuther for a truly special occasion!

The food was exceptional, with great attention to detail. Most dishes would have the last detail elegantly finished at the table.

After each course, more food would show up that was complimentary. I was worried the portion sizes would be small, but we left as full as could be.

The only thing that could match the extraordinary level of the food was the service. We started off with Tanner, who served us our drinks and took our orders. Next Edison was the one who was primarily serving all the food. Tanner would occasionally come back over to help. Beyond Tanner and Edison, there were 1 or 2 who were also around. Early on in the meal, Edison noticed I was left handed, so he moved my silverware (which was switched after each plate) to my left side and switched the right handed silverware to left handed silverware. I had no idea left handed silverware existed! Right before we left, we were gifted a box of chocolates.

The atmosphere was incredible. It felt luxurious but comfortable. In a place that could have easily been pretentiousness, it was as far removed from judgment as possible. The restaurant was very large and very spacious. The seating was large leather couches. It was a bit loud, but almost in an intentional way. You certainly could have private conversations if you wanted without the worry of being overheard.

Gabriel Kreuther lived up to my every expectation and exceeded them all. I would strongly suggest them to anyone who wants a world class experience.

10 out of 10

For us the experience was absolute perfection.

Service spectacular and on point

Chef's tasting was creative and delectable

Enjoyed the wine pairing as well

So welcoming and as a Michelin star experience should be from start to finish

My guest and I had a great experience at this restaurant. The staff were all especially attentive and friendly, and answered all of our questions. The alcoholic as well as nonalcoholic drinks were really great. The only person that was a little bit snobbish/odd vibes was the woman who kept pushing her wines, everything else was great. The food was good, not great but good enough and satisfying.  All of the extras and incentives were really nice too, little off-menu snacks and lots of sweet treats.  Price is high but thatâ€™s to be expected. Would recommend definitely try it out for yourself and see.

Canâ€™t say enough good things about Gabriel Kreuther as a whole. The staff was incredibly attentive to our every need, it was easily the best service Iâ€™ve experienced in a restaurant. We celebrated my wifeâ€™s birthday and the entire team went out of there way to make it a special evening, even going as far to introduce us to the team in the kitchen. The tasting menu was incredible, with different flavors that made every bite an experience in itself. Great place to go for any occasion big or small, highly recommended for anyone who loves food.

Wow. What an excellent fine dining experience at Gabriel Kreuther , just across from Bryant Park. We went there while on our trip to NYC and loved everything about this restaurant. Thomas, our server , was amazing. We had the 3 course meal, and it was delicious. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a fine dining experience in NYC.

Will Cesark and his staff made our experience at the chef table incredible.

Of course, the food was delicious, the wine pairing impeccable. Yes, go with the premium wine pairing. It applies to all tables and not only the chef table.

When I think about Gabriel Kreuther, I think excellence. Excellence in service, food, plating.

I highly recommend it. I am not an expert, but I give an educated opinion. I do chef table from NYC to Tokyo and Hawaii regularly. This restaurant is in my top 3, without a doubt.

We started our honeymoon here, and it turned into a showstopper of a meal. Easily one of the best weâ€™ve had, anywhere. The service was exceptional, with amazing attention to detail. Every course was exquisitely prepared and presented. The sauerkraut and sturgeon tart was as advertised, the lamb and duck were unreal. GK has earned their two Michelin stars, and we canâ€™t recommend them enough.

I celebrated my anniversary at Gabriel Kreuther (â€œGBâ€) this past Saturday, January 4th at 6:30 p.m. under â€œMichael Gâ€.  I mention these details so the restaurant can validate the legitimacy of this review, as my G-Mail account is under a different name.

Anyway, to put this review in context, I have dined at numerous Michelin-rated restaurants over the years in NYC (i.e., Le Bernardin, Eleven Madison Park, Jean-Georges, Le Coucou, Ai Fiori, and Marea, to name a few) and abroad (La Terrazza and Sensi in Italy).  However, it has been some time for a variety of reasons.  Nonetheless, my expectations have not changed, which is why I felt compelled to write this review given the more than lackluster service we received at GB when spending over $600 for two people for their 4-course prix fixe meal.

The night began with a text sent by the restaurant that read, "You're due at Gabriel Kreuther in 30 minutes."  I respect the need for a kind reminder, but I felt like my Mother was calling me for dinner.  Feeling an urge to rush to the restaurant, we learned after arriving 10 minutes early that our table was not ready...really?!  Once dinner began, however, service faux pas' continued to mount and included; 1) the waiters constantly serving our food from the right side and crossing over in front of our faces, 2) no proactive refilling of depleted water, 3) no cleaning of the table cloth despite very visible crumbs and food droppings, 4) a waiter taking my napkin when I went to the restroom and it taking almost 10 minutes to hail down another waiter and procure a replacement napkin, and 5) utensils haphazardly placed on the table.  However, the kicker occurred when my napkin dropped on the floor in front of a host who was present at my table.  Not only did the host not offer to pick up the napkin, he allowed me to continue using it.  Iâ€™m sure I sound like a pretentious fool, but fine dining is all about the experience and meeting reasonable expectations, as set and exemplified by other restaurants in the same tier.

I know Michelin stars primarily focus on food quality, creativity, and consistency, but when one pays at least double the cost for a dining experience, service must be a focal point, especially at a two star Michelin-rated restaurant.  I know it was at all the other Michelin-rated restaurants I dined at in the past and then some.  Truth be told, I have received better service at restaurants where the bill was one-third the cost.  Lastly, and all good restaurateurs know this, service is all about training, follow-up training, spotters focusing on a small area of tables, and hustle.  Unfortunately, our table conversation deviated to comparisons to other high-end restaurants we patronized versus the incredible experience we were expecting at GB.

To be fair to the restaurant, the food quality, presentation, consistency, serving pace, and occasional surprise â€œsnackâ€ warranted special distinction.  Moreover, the ambience, decor, background music (Sinatra, Dean Martin, etc.), and affable nature of the staff compared well to other high-end restaurants, but the lackluster service really detracted from the experience, which I'm very sorry to say.

One of the best, has to be top 5, restaurants you can go to in New York City. The service is top notch and the food will likely surpass most food that has ever entered your mouth. It was the type of meal where each dish had me guessing if another dish could top it, and the next one always did, and yet I couldnâ€™t pick a favorite dish at the end because they were all so tasty. You will experience many new flavors and flavor combinations in this meal.

The service was not only the highest quality, but also everyone from our waiter to the many men and women delivering our dishes and drinks all had good energies and character. It is very clear the level of care that goes into creating a good experience for everyone, waiters across the room are very clearly aware of you and the rest of the restaurant while still being attentive to the tables they are serving.

A perfect experience, looking forward to the next time I able to go.

Visited in November of 2024. California resident (me) very much was shocked by the generous food portion and flavorful tastes from the lunch chef's tasting menu in this NYC two Michelin star restaurant. Service style fits me. And the dining area is fine too. The food tastes are German related - I recall tasting sauerkraut under the best kaluga caviar starter. Also thankful that the kitchen switched the ube pearl for me in the menu. The ube pearl is so pretty! Didn't want to knock it apart to eat. Definitely will go back for a la carte or the short pre fixe menu.

All the dishes were exceptional. We had such a delightful dinner. Staffs were really attentive to details and professional.

I really recommend to visit for a special occasion or even just a great meal to treat yourself with incredible ambience.

It was such an amazing experience.
From the moment you step inside, the staff is beyond attentive. The decor is simple and elegant. Great drink selection.
Outstanding food. The prix fixe menu is an absolute must.
You can also stop by for French chocolate.

A once in a lifetime dining experience you definitely wonâ€™t regret. The food, the wine, the ambience and service all exceeded our expectations. A highlight was the sturgeon tart and the duck breast. Also definitely go for the wine pairing, it adds another interesting element to the experience.

This place is a little more under the radar than some of the other Michelin restaurants in NYC but I would argue offers the best value for the price. We both did the four course tasting menu and left feeling incredibly full.

The ambience in the restaurant and view of Bryant Park are so beautiful. We will hopefully be back again!

All Five Stars, Two Thumbs Up, & One Happy Stomach for this Michelin restaurant! This experience was definitely one of my favorite dining experiences! The service was top notch, and they definitely made us feel very special. The food wasâ€¦

A very memorable and stellar dining experience!  The chef tasting and wine pairing menu was absolutely outstanding.  The textures, flavours and presentations were an experience to behold.  The wine pairings were chosen with meticulousâ€¦

The best fine dining experience ever! I went there for my birthday, and everything was beyond my highest expectation - hand written birthday card signed by the chef, first class service,  complimentary appetizers, big portion meals even with a 3 course prix fix, amazing dish presentation, and the best kitchen peeps ever (Yes, I visited the kitchen!). The food is prepared and served with love, and I love the collaborative and welcoming vibe in the kitchen, Gabriel must have spent a lot of energy on fostering relationships with everyone, because you can tell staff members respects him from heart. Will definitely come over again, and hopefully can greet the chef in person next time.
